tagline: Personal responsibility hardliner - blames plaintiffs for their own problems
what_they_believe: People are responsible for their own outcomes. Injuries happen because people weren't careful. Lawsuits are usually money grabs. Corporations create jobs and shouldn't be punished for every accident.
how_they_behave_in_deliberation: Will argue plaintiff contributed to their own injury. Will minimize damages ('that's not worth a million dollars'). Will resist emotional appeals. Often vocal and may try to lead.
how_to_spot_them: Stories about overcoming hardship without help or lawsuits
Phrases like 'personal responsibility,' 'nobody forced them,' 'common sense'
Skepticism about lawsuits, insurance costs, 'lottery justice'
Business owner, sales, management, or self-employed

personas.name: Bootstrap Bob
personas.tagline: I built everything I have. Nobody handed me anything.
personas.instant_read: Classic self-made man. Will blame plaintiff for not being careful.
personas.backstory: Worked way through college selling cars. Built 30-year career in sales through 'hard work and showing up.' Father was a machinist who worked through chronic back pain and never sued anyone. Sister filed bankruptcy from credit card debt - Bob sees this as 'poor choices.' Has never sued anyone and is proud of it.
phrases_youll_hear: Nobody put a gun to their head
At the end of the day, you're responsible for yourself
Play stupid games, win stupid prizes
There's two sides to every story
I've never sued anyone and never will

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Will push for minimum. Economic only, heavily reduced.
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Vocal advocate for defense. May try to lead.

strike_or_keep.defense_strategy: KEEP. Dream juror who will do your work for you.

personas.name: Tough-Love Tina
personas.tagline: I raised two kids alone working two jobs. Don't tell me about hardship.
personas.instant_read: Overcame real adversity. Resents people who 'can't handle' what she handled.
personas.backstory: Divorced from 'lazy' husband when kids were young. Worked two jobs while getting associate's degree. Raised two kids alone and put them through college. Brother is on disability - she believes he could work if he tried. Sees her success as proof that excuses are just that.
phrases_youll_hear: I raised two kids alone and never asked for a handout
Excuses are just that - excuses
If I could do it, anyone can
Some people just want the easy way out

verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Shares personal story as counter to plaintiff sympathy.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: STRIKE. Her story will undercut sympathy for your client.
strike_or_keep.defense_strategy: KEEP. Credible voice for personal responsibility.

personas.name: MAGA Mike
personas.tagline: Lawsuits are killing American business. Trial lawyers are parasites.
personas.instant_read: Trump voter, Fox News watcher. Sees lawsuits as liberal attack on business.
personas.backstory: Built car dealership from single lot to three locations. Been sued twice by employees and customers - considers both frivolous. Active in local Republican politics. Believes tort reform is essential. Gets news from Fox News and conservative talk radio. Sees trial lawyers as Democrats who hurt business.
phrases_youll_hear: Trial lawyers are destroying this country
Everyone's looking for a payday
This is lawsuit lottery
Regulations are strangling business
In my day, we handled things ourselves

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Absolute minimum. Will argue for zero.
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Loud, aggressive defense advocate. May alienate some jurors.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: STRIKE IMMEDIATELY or challenge for cause if possible.
strike_or_keep.defense_strategy: KEEP but be aware he may be too aggressive and turn off moderate jurors.

personas.name: Offer-It-Up Olive
personas.tagline: Suffering is part of God's plan. Money doesn't heal anything.
personas.instant_read: Deep religious belief that lawsuits reject God's will.

demographics.family: Widowed (husband died of 9/11-related cancer), 4 adult kids

personas.backstory: Husband was first responder who developed cancer from 9/11 exposure. Despite clear causation, she refused to sue or join victim fund - believes suffering should be 'offered up to God.' Raised to never sue. Sees lawsuits as rejecting God's plan and being ungrateful.
phrases_youll_hear: God has a plan for everything
We don't sue people in my family
You offer it up to God
Money doesn't fix anything
My husband died and I never asked for a dime

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Will award almost nothing. Believes money for suffering is wrong.
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Quiet but immovable. May be holdout for defense.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: CHALLENGE FOR CAUSE. Her beliefs prevent her from awarding damages.

personas.name: By-The-Book Bill
personas.tagline: Follow the rules and you won't get hurt. Simple as that.
personas.instant_read: Military/law enforcement. If plaintiff violated any rule, case over.
personas.backstory: 20 years Army, retired as Sergeant First Class. Now works security. Values discipline, rules, and following procedures. Believes most injuries happen because someone didn't follow the rules. BUT: If defendant clearly violated rules/regulations, may hold them accountable.
phrases_youll_hear: If you follow the rules, you won't have problems
In the Army, we had standards for a reason
Did they follow proper procedure?
Discipline prevents accidents
What were they thinking?

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Moderate. Respects proper compensation if rules were broken.
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Focuses on whether procedures were followed by BOTH sides.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: MAY KEEP if defendant clearly violated rules/regulations. He respects standards.
strike_or_keep.defense_strategy: KEEP if plaintiff violated any safety rule. CONSIDER STRIKING if your client broke clear rules.

personas.name: Sued-And-Bitter Betty
personas.tagline: I was sued for something that wasn't my fault. I know how this game works.
personas.instant_read: Was defendant in lawsuit. Traumatized. Sees all plaintiffs as scammers.
personas.backstory: Sued twice by customers claiming slip-and-fall injuries. Believes both were fraudulent. First case settled (felt like extortion), second dismissed after $45K in legal fees. Nearly lost her business. Deeply hostile to plaintiffs and their attorneys.
phrases_youll_hear: I've been on the other side of this
Do you know what it costs to defend yourself?
People lie to get money
I know how this game works
I nearly lost my business over a lying customer

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Minimum possible. Deep suspicion of all claims.
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Will share her story. Projects her experience onto case.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: CHALLENGE FOR CAUSE or strike. Her trauma makes her incapable of fairness.
strike_or_keep.defense_strategy: KEEP. She'll fight for you based on personal experience.

personas.name: American-Dream Ivan
personas.tagline: I came to America with $50. Built a business. What's your excuse?
personas.instant_read: Immigrant success story. Extreme 'no excuses' mentality.
personas.backstory: Immigrated from Soviet Ukraine in 1985 with almost nothing. Engineering degree wasn't recognized, so started as HVAC technician. Built company from scratch, now employs 25 people. Sees America as land of unlimited opportunity for those willing to work. Views lawsuits as weakness.
phrases_youll_hear: I came here with $50 in my pocket
In Soviet Union, you had real problems
Americans don't know how good they have it
Work hard, don't complain - that's how you succeed
Everybody wants something for nothing now

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Absolute minimum. 'This is nothing compared to real suffering.'
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Compelling storyteller. His success story undercuts sympathy.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: MUST STRIKE. His story will dominate deliberations.

personas.name: Stoic-Farm-Wife Fran
personas.tagline: We don't sue our neighbors. We help them fix the fence.
personas.instant_read: Rural values. Lawsuits are shameful. Handle problems yourself.
personas.backstory: Grew up on farm, married a farmer. Has weathered droughts, floods, cattle disease, and injuries. Husband broke arm in combine accident - never considered suing equipment manufacturer. Views lawsuits as failure of character and community. Deeply distrusts 'city lawyers.'
phrases_youll_hear: We handle things ourselves out here
A lawsuit would destroy a family's reputation
City people sue over every little thing
If you can't tough it out, farming isn't for you
We don't sue our neighbors

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Minimal. Views large awards as shameful greed.
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Quiet but firm. Rural common sense perspective.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: STRIKE. Her worldview opposes lawsuits fundamentally.

personas.name: Fox-News Frank
personas.tagline: I've seen the stories about ridiculous lawsuits. This system is broken.
personas.instant_read: Conservative media consumer. Primed to see all lawsuits as frivolous.
personas.backstory: Union plumber for 35 years, now retired. Despite union background, has become very conservative. Watches Fox News several hours daily. Has absorbed narrative about 'lawsuit abuse' and 'tort reform.' Regularly cites stories about ridiculous lawsuits (some urban legends). Believes trial lawyers are Democrats destroying America.
phrases_youll_hear: Did you see that story about the woman who sued over hot coffee?
Trial lawyers own the Democrat party
These lawsuits are why everything costs so much
Tort reform would fix this country
Personal responsibility is dead

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Minimal. Sees any large award as 'lawsuit lottery.'
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Will cite media stories as evidence of lawsuit abuse.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: STRIKE. He's been programmed to reject your case.

personas.name: Doctors-Are-Heroes Diana
personas.tagline: My father saved thousands of lives and still got sued twice.
personas.instant_read: Medical family. Will defend doctors/hospitals almost unconditionally.
personas.backstory: Father was surgeon, mother was nurse. Grew up hearing about the 'heroes' in medicine. Father was sued twice despite 'saving thousands of lives' - both cases dismissed but cost money and stress. Works in pharmaceutical sales, reinforcing medical industry loyalty. Will defend healthcare providers instinctively.
phrases_youll_hear: My father saved thousands of lives and still got sued twice
Patients don't follow instructions and then blame doctors
Medicine isn't perfect - bad outcomes aren't always malpractice
Do you know what malpractice insurance costs?
Everyone thinks they know better than their doctor because of Google

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Low. Sympathy is with medical providers.
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Will educate jury about how 'unfair' medical lawsuits are.
verdict_prediction.special_note: IN MEDICAL MALPRACTICE CASES: Liability probability drops to 10%. MUST STRIKE.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: CHALLENGE FOR CAUSE in med mal. Strike in other cases.
strike_or_keep.defense_strategy: KEEP. Especially valuable in medical cases.
